overview: Ethics and Professional Practice: Policies that affect oral health practice, dental professional practice regulation and legislation, the principles and application of ethics to health care and human research, privacy, record keeping and health consumer issues; ethics and professional practice.

Applied Health Education: School curriculum frameworks, settings and strategies for health education, educational technology and aids for oral health and applied health education experience via in-class practical sessions and field visits.
ilo: Work effectively with individuals and groups to improve health literacy and promote their oral health;
Plan, deliver and evaluate oral health education for community groups;
Use culturally sensitive approaches in communication and health promotion;
Apply ethical principles to the practice of oral health therapy
Use a research framework to plan for the oral health therapy research project undertaken in third year.
generic_skills: Conflict resolution and management of people;
Planning, delivery and evaluation of programs; and

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: One assignment of no more than 1000 words
One report of no more than 2000 words

assessment.hurdle: 75% attendance at Lectures; 100% attendance at Seminars/Tutorials and Practical Classes

date_times.contact_hours: 60 hours of lectures, seminars, computer assisted learning, practical work, field visits and field practical work.
